text: hi my needle drops Anthony Fantino here
the Internet's busiest music nerd and
wearing the earth shirt today because I
thought it was appropriate to do a
review of the new Melvin's album the
bride screamed murder before I get too
deep into this review I just want to say
the Chicago hip-hop outfit the cool kids
actually have a new mixtape out you can
download it for free there's a link in
the d box check it out alright The
Melvins
are one of the most significant rock
bands of all time influencing countless
artists from Boris to tool to Mastodon
and playing a huge part in defining what
we now know today as sludge metal I'm
gonna spare you the minor details and
the origin stories and all that crap and
simply say that if you're not into the
Melvin's you could pretty much grab
anything that they put out from the late
80s to the mid 90s it's like shooting
fish in a barrel it's when the band put
out their most career-defining work
really their best stuff and then the
entire scheme of things this album is
Melvin's 20th yeah 2-0 and it's really
got some classic Melvin sounds on it
some dime stop riffs really rough guitar
distortion plus they carry on a lot of
tricks that they were really pushing on
albums like nude with boots like
doubling up on the vocals and making
them sound really huge really
experimenting with vocal harmonies
humbling drums delivered by not one but
two drummers and concentrating on making
their songs feel a little weird or a
little stranger more complex instead of
submitting to the specific simplicity's
of sludge metal and there's some pretty
psychedelic moments on this album too
the heavy heavy fuzz on I'll finish you
off really reminds me of how badass this
band was in their prime or I guess since
they're still kind of bad at anyway the
heavy fuzz the strange vocals on that
track too which sort of took me by
surprise really made it feel like a very
surreal experience throughout these nine
tracks there are several moments where I
found myself sitting there just
thinking wow these guys could seriously
still pen a tune they could still pump
out a memorable riff it's just nice to
know that after years and years of The
Melvins just punishing our auditory
senses that they could still put a good
dent in the old eardrum the one thing I
didn't really enjoy about the album is
that there was a real pervasive
ridiculousness on a lot of the tracks
especially on these really noisy
transitional moments at the end of some
of the songs where you hear some
squelching horns some really weird
keyboard or some freaky vocals
it just makes me think The Melvins are
trying to get away from their old sound
trying to redefine themselves as a band
they don't really want to do the same
thing over and over and over but instead
of innovating instead of just pursuing a
new altogether different sound they're
just trying to use absurdity to kind of
drift themselves away from their older
style and it's not exactly functioning
that well for me there are some moments
where this absurdity kind of drifts into
some of the tracks on the LP for example
the first song the water glass just
starts off with really pummeling drums
really heavy riffs really got me excited
but then it kind of broke into this
militaristic Colin respond routine that
really was not working for me at all but
I think the most tongue-in-cheek moment
of the entire album is yes there's a
cover on this LP of the who's my
generation the vocals are really weird
the song is done in a really sludgy
fashion and it just feels a little like
novelty it just feels like a little bit
like kind of a joke as a whole to tell
you the truth I'm kind of indifferent on
this album and I'm feeling a decent 5 on
it it's not awful however I'm not really
loving it all that much and before you
go crying and crying your eyes out don't
know he gave it a 5 just you know come
on come on we know The Melvins are great
we know that their power is undeniable
however they have put out way way way
way way better stuff in their career
don't lie to yourselves you and I both
know this also they've been a lot more
consistent
on their albums too but the Melvin's are
still to be worshipped and respected and
if you're into heavy music if you're
into heavy metal if you're into loud
rock and you're not listening to the
Melvin's you're seriously seriously
missing out because these guys should be
an essential part of any musical diet so
if you're looking for something strange
loud distorted an album that does not
stay in one spot or something that is
going to allow you to explore the psyche
of sludge then by all means give this a
listen and it also looks like yeah yeah
there are a few Melvin's fans watching I
see you what do you think of this do you
love it do you hate it and why and also
favorite tracks all right Anthony
Fantana The Melvins the bride screaming
murder forever
